title: Montaudon NV Grande Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: Warm and soft, this ripe wine has mature fruitiness that shines through gentle texture. With a relatively high dosage, it is an easy wine to enjoy as an aperitif. Drink now.

title: Paul Buisse NV Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: A crisp blend of four grapes, this lively wine is dry, full of citrus flavors with a bright, clean aftertaste. The wine, just hinting at toast as well as riper yellow fruits, is ready to drink.

title: Paumanok 2017 Dry Chenin Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Restrained aromas of citrus, apple peel and limestone carry to the immensely zesty palate. Electric acidity carries from start to finish, ending on a sour lime note.

title: Poderi Elia 2014 Serracapelli  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with aromas of espresso, coconut and vanilla. The assertive palate offers roasted coffee bean, clove and chewing tobacco set against grainy, astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Rafael Cambra 2016 Mateo Cambra  (Rioja)
description: Medicinal, rubbery berry aromas require airing to settle. In the mouth, this Rioja Garnacha is plump and round but with only medium-level concentration. A rubbery flavor is attached to plum and berry notes, while this is standard on the finish.

title: Roberto Sarotto 2015 Currà  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with subdued aromas of ripe dark fruit, coconut and baking spice. The dense palate offers prune, espresso and star anise alongside close-grained, rather evolved tannins. You can feel the heat of evident alcohol on the finish.

title: Shingleback NV Black Bubbles Sparkling Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: After a fair amount of swirling in glass, this offers notes of plums, ripe berries and pepper spice set against an earthy backdrop. It's lightly fizzy and slightly sweetness, but is accompanied by robust, drying tannins. The fizz dissipates quickly, leaving the wine feeling flat.

title: Spicy Vines 2015 Edge Red (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is an old field blend of Zinfandel, Petite Sirah, Carignan, Cinsault and Grenache, cofermented together and aged nearly two years in French oak, a small percentage of it new. The wine is thick in muddled red fruit and possessed of a soft rich texture.

title: Winery by the Creek 2015 Le Grand Vin Red (Fair Play)
description: Big, oaky and already well aged, this full-bodied wine has plenty of structure filled in with spicy cedary aromas and vanilla and black-cherry flavors. Firm tannins give it a hefty mouthfeel.

title: Bianchi 2015 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Quite shy on the nose, this bottling offers dark red fruit and sandalwood with patience. The palate is a bit flat, with basic red-fruit and wild herb flavors.

title: Bodegas Bleda 2017 Castillo de Jumilla Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Scratchy, oaky aromas of pencil eraser, wood grain, vanilla and raspberry lead to a dense thick chewy palate. Herbal, salty plum and berry flavors finish tannic, grabby and sticky.

title: Cortes de Cima 2017 Chaminé Rosé (Alentejano)
description: A fresh and crisp wine that has plenty of acidity and attractive red-currant fruits. It is a light and bright blend of Aragonez and Syrah, ready to drink now.

title: Domaine Fouassier 2015  Sancerre
description: This bottling has a bitter edge from the toasty wood that masks the red-cherry fruits and gives the wine a strongly spicy character. Drink now.

title: Landshut 2017 Pinot Grigio (Pfalz)
description: Hints of yellow apple and pear are marked by savory, earthen tones in this light-bodied Pinot Grigio. It's moderate in concentration but offers fresh acidity and a dry, easygoing palate.

title: Les Frères Couillaud 2017 Bernier Chardonnay Chardonnay (Val de Loire)
description: This soft wine offers simple apple and apricot flavors. Everything is in balance to give a gentle, smooth wine that is ready to drink.

title: MAN Family Wines NV Brut Chenin Blanc (South Africa)
description: This is pleasant and easy-drinking, with notes of fresh-cut apple, orange pith, lemon rind and a touch of talc. It's light in weight, with brisk acidity, high carbonation and tart lime, green apple and plum notes that are short but refreshing.

title: Paul Buisse 2015 Clos du Gaimont Moelleux  (Vouvray)
description: Although labeled Moelleux this wine is rather half-hearted about being sweet. It is delicious with acidity and baked-apple flavors, but misses out on intensity. Drink this wine now.

title: R. Stuart & Co. NV Rosé d'OR Sparkling (Oregon)
description: A yellowish copper shade, this forward and fruity wine seems slightly oxidized, though not necessarily to its detriment. It's loaded with Christmas cake flavors and finishes with a metallic aftertaste. Drink up.

title: Scala Dei 2016 Garnatxa (Priorat)
description: Rubbery aromas of latex and sulfur give way to jumpy red-berry and animal notes. A jammy sappy palate requires airing to show its best, while this varietal Garnatxa tastes of herbal raspberry and red plum. A rubbery grating finish fits the overall package.

title: Taliano 2011 Montersino Tera Mia Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: The shy nose eventually reveals camphor, raisin and cooking spice. The tight palate offers prune, dark spice and mocha alongside firm drying tannins that grip the finish.
